titleStmt.title: An Electronic Edition of the Mishnah, Paris Manuscript (Bibliothèque nationale de France, Hébreu 328-329)
titleStmt.sponsor: Joseph and Rebecca Meyerhoff Center for Jewish Studies
Lieberman Institute; Primary Witnesses to Tannaitic Literature

publicationStmt.pubPlace: The Maryland Institute for Technology in the Humanities

availability.p: This work is copyright Hayim Lapin and the Joseph and Rebecca Meyerhoff Center for Jewish Studies and licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License.

note.p: Text of the Mishnah from the Bibliothèque nationale de France. MS Hébreu 328-329 Transcribed from: Mishnah-Codex Paris, Paris 328-329 (Jerusalem: Makor, 1973).
This document replaces the sample version prepared by Daniel Goldberg, Paris.xml

handNote.note: Bar Asher describes the pointing as reflecting a unique tradition

revisionDesc.change: Transcription of Bavot by Nurit Ezer

ab.w:
לשבור
Raised circle for insertion point.

ab.label: ב׳
ab.w: ישמעאל Scribe (second hand?) has added small mark to note missing א. Perhaps creating אל ligature.

ab.label: י׳
ab.w: לחבPointing with hiriq under מ; transcriber proposed that a second scribe corrected to עמי,ירו
ab.label: י״א
ג׳
ab.w:
מלין
Horizontal line marks insertion point.
ab.label: ד׳
ו׳
ab.w: ול Perhaps a correction, rather than a ligature.א

ab.label: ו׳
ab.w:
בשעה
Two dots mark insertion point.
